description: Both chapters cover template-based code generation architecture. The thesis.tex version is a condensed summary (81 lines) while the standalone file is a comprehensive treatment (743 lines - 9x longer). Both cover: Template System Overview, Two-Phase Generation, Tera Template Engine, YAML Frontmatter, Template Structure, and Template Engineering Principles.
overlapping_concepts: Two-phase generation pipeline (Query Phase and Render Phase)
Tera template engine description and features
Template structure with example code listing
Template engineering principles (separation of concerns, composability, readability, defensiveness)
duplicate_sections: Section 'Template System Overview' appears in both with identical structure
Subsection 'Two-Phase Generation' - identical concept and benefits list
Section 'Tera Template Engine' - same description of features
Subsection 'Template Structure' - same YAML frontmatter example
duplicate_code_listings: Template with YAML frontmatter example (entities.mjs generation) - appears in both versions
recommendation: Replace the brief Chapter 3 in thesis.tex with the comprehensive chapter3-template-architecture.tex content. The standalone file contains significantly more detail including: abstract, detailed Tera configuration code, frontmatter field specifications, template composition patterns, SPARQL result injection mechanisms, performance benchmarks, case studies, and comparison tables. Alternatively, if brevity is required, add a note in thesis.tex Chapter 3 directing readers to the extended version.

description: Both chapters address OpenAPI 3.0 specification generation from RDF ontologies. The thesis.tex version provides a minimal overview (63 lines) while the standalone is a comprehensive treatment (1020 lines - 16x longer). Both explain the OpenAPI standard, ontology-to-OpenAPI mapping, four-part generation pipeline, and constraint representation.
overlapping_concepts: Mapping RDF entities to OpenAPI schemas
Four-part generation pipeline (Info, Schemas, Paths, Combined)
duplicate_sections: Section 'OpenAPI 3.0 Standard' - identical high-level description
Section 'Generating OpenAPI from Ontology' - same mapping bullets
Subsection 'Four-Part Generation Pipeline' - identical four-stage enumeration
Section 'Constraint Representation' - same RDF and YAML examples
duplicate_code_listings: RDF constraint example for User_email property - identical in both
OpenAPI YAML constraint mapping for email field - identical in both
recommendation: Replace Chapter 4 in thesis.tex with the comprehensive chapter4_openapi_generation.tex content. The standalone includes extensive additional material: detailed REST API documentation format, OpenAPI version history, comprehensive SPARQL queries for schema extraction, endpoint definition extraction, request/response schema generation, server configuration, synchronization strategy details, quality assurance sections, validation methods, consistency checking code, compliance checklists, documentation coverage analysis, and integration workflows. If space is limited, use the standalone as the primary chapter and reduce thesis.tex Chapter 4 to a cross-reference.

chapter_1: thesis.tex Chapter 7 (Type Guards and Runtime Validation)
description: Both chapters focus on type guards and runtime validation in TypeScript/JavaScript. The thesis.tex version is a brief summary (66 lines) while the standalone is exhaustive (977 lines - 15x longer). Both discuss type guard fundamentals, generation from entity definitions, implementation strategies, and TypeScript integration.
overlapping_concepts: Type guards as runtime type narrowing mechanisms
Generation of type guards from entity definitions
Guard implementation strategies (direct checks, schema-based, recursive)
duplicate_sections: Section 'Type Guards in JavaScript' - identical introduction and isUser example
Section 'Generating Type Guard Functions' - same isUser code listing with minor variations
Section 'Guard Implementation Strategies' - same three-item enumeration
Section 'Integration with Type Systems' - identical TypeScript narrowing example
duplicate_code_listings: isUser type guard function - appears in both with nearly identical implementation
Type narrowing example with data.email access - identical in both
Generated type guard for User entity - nearly identical code
recommendation: Replace Chapter 7 in thesis.tex with chapter7_type_guards.tex content. The standalone file provides substantial additional coverage including: detailed introduction on the gap between static types and runtime behavior, type narrowing fundamentals, discriminated unions, exhaustiveness checking, SPARQL queries for guard metadata, XSD to JavaScript type mapping tables, array and object guards, schema-based validation patterns, recursive guards for nested types, performance optimization (caching, memoization, lazy validation), benchmarking methodology and results, compositional guard patterns, higher-order guards, comprehensive testing strategies (property-based testing, edge cases, precision/recall metrics), and extensive code examples. The standalone is significantly more rigorous and complete.

description: Structural redundancy exists between the complete thesis.tex file containing condensed inline chapters and the standalone detailed chapter files. This creates a 'two-version' problem where the same content exists in abbreviated and expanded forms, potentially causing confusion about which version is authoritative.
overlapping_concepts: All core concepts from template architecture, OpenAPI generation, and type guards appear in both versions
Code examples are duplicated with varying levels of detail
Section structure is similar but depth varies dramatically
duplicate_sections: All major sections from chapters 3, 4, and 7 appear in both locations
Subsection headings are often identical even when content depth differs
recommendation: Adopt one of three resolution strategies: (1) Single Source: Make thesis.tex the single source of truth and remove standalone files, expanding inline chapters to match standalone depth. (2) Modular Approach: Convert thesis.tex to use \include or \input directives to reference standalone chapter files, eliminating duplication entirely. (3) Hierarchical Documentation: Keep thesis.tex as a condensed overview/summary document and clearly mark standalone files as 'extended/detailed chapters' with cross-references. Recommended: Option 2 (Modular) is cleanest - modify thesis.tex to include external chapter files rather than duplicating content.

description: Both files describe the Tera template engine with nearly identical feature lists. The thesis.tex version provides a brief bullet list while the standalone expands with detailed explanations and Rust code examples.
overlapping_concepts: Tera as Rust-native template language inspired by Jinja2
duplicate_sections: Feature list for Tera template engine is nearly identical
duplicate_code_listings: None - thesis.tex omits code examples that appear in standalone
recommendation: When consolidating, use the comprehensive Tera description from chapter3-template-architecture.tex which includes actual Rust code for Tera configuration, detailed explanations of each feature, and technical implementation details.

chapter_2: chapter4_openapi_generation.tex - Synchronization Strategy / Four-Part Generation Pipeline
section_2: Lines 316-571 (Section 3: Synchronization Strategy with extensive detail)
description: Both describe the four-stage OpenAPI generation pipeline, but the standalone file provides dramatically more detail including SPARQL queries for each stage, complete YAML examples, and orchestration details.
overlapping_concepts: Four-stage pipeline: Info, Schemas, Paths, Combined
duplicate_sections: Four-item enumeration of generation stages - identical structure
Stage names and descriptions match exactly
duplicate_code_listings: None in thesis.tex brief version; standalone includes extensive SPARQL queries and YAML examples for each stage
recommendation: Use the comprehensive synchronization strategy section from chapter4_openapi_generation.tex. It includes detailed SPARQL queries for info extraction (with contact/license details), complete schema generation examples, path definition examples with full operation specifications, and the ggen sync command for combination. The standalone version provides actionable implementation detail versus the thesis.tex summary.

description: Both cover guard implementation strategies, but thesis.tex provides only a three-item enumeration while the standalone includes detailed subsections with extensive code examples for direct property checks, schema-based validation, recursive guards, and conditional logic.
overlapping_concepts: Direct checks using property existence and type checking
Recursive guards for nested object structures
duplicate_sections: Three strategy categories are identical in name and order
duplicate_code_listings: None in thesis.tex; standalone includes isPerson direct check implementation, ClassSchema interface definition, validateAgainstSchema function, isDepartment recursive guard, and conditional validation functions
recommendation: Replace with comprehensive section from chapter7_type_guards.tex which includes: Direct Property Check Strategy with O(n) complexity analysis and early termination benefits, Schema-Based Validation with PropertyValidator and ClassSchema interfaces plus validateAgainstSchema implementation, Recursive Guards for Nested Types with cycle detection considerations, and Conditional Logic for owl:Restriction handling. The standalone provides implementable patterns versus abstract strategy names.

section_2: Various locations throughout all chapter files
description: Both the thesis and standalone chapters refer to the 'ggen framework' as the implementation context. Definitions and explanations of ggen appear redundantly across files.
overlapping_concepts: ggen as ontology-driven code generation framework
duplicate_sections: Framework references appear in introductions and implementation sections
duplicate_code_listings: ggen sync commands appear in multiple locations
recommendation: Establish a single authoritative introduction to ggen in Chapter 1 or a dedicated Framework Overview section, then use consistent cross-references throughout all chapters. Avoid re-explaining ggen in each chapter.

description: Both chapters use OpenAPI-related templates as examples, creating some conceptual overlap in demonstrating template usage for OpenAPI generation.
duplicate_sections: OpenAPI schema template examples appear in both contexts
duplicate_code_listings: Similar schema generation templates referenced in chapter4
recommendation: Cross-reference between chapters rather than duplicating examples. Chapter 3 should focus on template mechanics using OpenAPI as one example, while Chapter 4 should reference Chapter 3's template explanation and focus on the OpenAPI-specific generation logic. Add explicit cross-references: 'For template architecture details, see Chapter 3, Section X.'

chapter_1: thesis.tex - Code listing styles and formatting
chapter_2: All standalone chapter files - Code listing styles
description: Code listings use inconsistent language tags and styling across files. Some use 'language=javascript', others 'language=JavaScript', some use 'language=typescript', 'language=sparql', 'language=SPARQL', etc.
duplicate_sections: Similar code examples formatted differently
duplicate_code_listings: JavaScript/TypeScript examples use varying language tags
recommendation: Standardize code listing language tags across all files: use lowercase (javascript, typescript, sparql, turtle, yaml, rust, bash) consistently. Update lstlisting preamble definitions to match. Apply consistent caption formatting.
